excerpt: Nigeria deportasi Dai Qisheng, seorang pemimpin geng kenamaan yang jadi buron di China.

title: Hongkongers squawk-off in city's first bird call contest
excerpt: Bird lovers dressed up and took to the stage to mimic rhythmic calls in a competition aimed at promoting conservation awareness.

title: Jerry Adler, who starred in The Sopranos, dies aged 96
excerpt: Adler started acting in his early 60s, after some 30 years working behind the scenes on Broadway.

title: Zelensky Sebut Pertemuan dengan Putin Efektif Akhiri Perang
excerpt: Presiden Ukraina Volodymyr Zelensky menilai pertemuannya dengan Presiden Rusia Vladimir Putin merupakan cara efektif untuk mengakhiri perang.

title: Chinese property giant Evergrande delisted after spectacular fall
excerpt: The embattled property giant's shares were taken off the Hong Kong stock market on Monday.

title: France summons US envoy over antisemitism claims
excerpt: France denies allegations it is failing to tackle a surge in antisemitism since the Gaza war began.

title: Serangan Udara Israel ke Yaman Tewaskan 2 Orang
excerpt: Sebanyak dua orang tewas dan lima orang luka-luka akibat serangan udara Israel ke Sanaa, ibu kota Yaman pada Minggu (24/8).

title: How Russia is quietly trying to win over the world beyond the West
excerpt: Over the past three years, Russian state-backed news channel RT has expanded its international presence.

title: A cut-off finger ended her comfortable family life. Now she's hiding from US officials
excerpt: Donald Trump declared some cartels to be terrorist organisations. So why are the victims of cartels in hiding?

title: PM Kanada Mark Carney Serukan Gencatan Senjata di Ukraina
excerpt: Dalam kunjungannya ke Ukraina, Carney menggunakan kesempatan ini untuk menyerukan gencatan senjata.

title: Monsoon rains happen every year. So why do so many die in Pakistan?
excerpt: Since June of this year alone, monsoon rains have killed at least 750 people across the country.

title: Trump threatens to deploy troops to Baltimore to 'clean up' crime
excerpt: The deployment of military for domestic law enforcement has drawn backlash from Democrats, with one governor calling it an "abuse of power".

title: Inside Donetsk as residents flee attacks on Ukrainian region Putin wants to control
excerpt: Quentin Sommerville follows volunteers carrying out evacuations in eastern Ukraine as drone attacks rage.

title: AS-Venezuela Tegang, Ini Alasan Trump Kirim 3 Kapal Perang
excerpt: Presiden Trump mengerahkan tiga kapal perang ke Venezuela untuk memberantas narkoba. Presiden Venezuela Nicolas Maduro langsung memobilisasi milisi.

title: More than 500,000 ordered to evacuate as typhoon heads for Vietnam
excerpt: Typhoon Kajiki is brushing past Hainan in China before heading for Vietnam, forecasters say.

title: Jurnalis Tewas di Gaza Capai 240 Orang, Lampaui Angka Perang Dunia
excerpt: Jumlah jurnalis yang tewas akibat serangan Israel dalam perang yang berlangsung di Jalur Gaza telah mencapai 240 orang.

title: Three sisters drown in migrant boat in Mediterranean, rescuers say
excerpt: There was "sheer horror" when survivors realised that the girls aged nine, 11 and 17 had died, a rescuer says.

title: Ukraina Serang Kilang Minyak Rusia, Harga Bensin Moskow Naik Tajam
excerpt: Serangan Ukraina ke kilang minyak hingga stasiun pompa Rusia menyebabkan harga bensin di Moskow capai rekor tertinggi.

title: Israel pounds Gaza City in preparation for planned offensive
excerpt: Sixty-four people were killed in Israeli attacks across Gaza in the past 24 hours, the territory's Hamas-run health ministry said.

title: VIDEO: Aktivis Bentangkan Spanduk Anti Trump di Patung Kristus
excerpt: Anggota Alvorada Collective membentangkan spanduk anti-Trump di landmark ikonik Patung Kristus Penebus, Rio de Janeiro, Sabtu (23/8).

title: Watch: Solar-powered cars start epic Australian outback race
excerpt: Thirty-four teams from all over the world are competing to win the 2025 Bridgestone World Solar Challenge.

title: My trip to North Korea's 'Benidorm' - flanked by guards and full of rules
excerpt: Anastasia, one of the first Russian visitors to North Korea's new resort, tells of "immaculate" beaches, meaty meals and strict rules.

title: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano erupts creating lava fountain
excerpt: Kilauea, on Hawaii's Big Island, started spewing fresh lava on 22 August, the Hawaiian Volcano Observatory said.

title: Prison conduct, remorse and contraband: What we learned from Menendez parole hearings
excerpt: Phones, candles and behaviour by the long-term US inmates factored into the refusal of their release.
